<div class="docs-body">
  <div class="api-ref">
    <div class="section md">
      <div class="markdown-content">
        <div class="anchor-heading-root">
          <a
            class="anchor-heading-link"
            href="/docs/api-reference/introduction"
          >
            <h2 class="anchor-heading" data-name="introduction">
              Introduction<svg
                stroke="currentColor"
                fill="currentColor"
                stroke-width="0"
                viewBox="0 0 20 20"
                aria-hidden="true"
                class="anchor-heading-icon"
                height="15px"
                width="15px"
                xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
              >
                <path
                  fill-rule="evenodd"
                  d="M12.586 4.586a2 2 0 112.828 2.828l-3 3a2 2 0 01-2.828 0 1 1 0 00-1.414 1.414 4 4 0 005.656 0l3-3a4 4 0 00-5.656-5.656l-1.5 1.5a1 1 0 101.414 1.414l1.5-1.5zm-5 5a2 2 0 012.828 0 1 1 0 101.414-1.414 4 4 0 00-5.656 0l-3 3a4 4 0 105.656 5.656l1.5-1.5a1 1 0 10-1.414-1.414l-1.5 1.5a2 2 0 11-2.828-2.828l3-3z"
                  clip-rule="evenodd"
                ></path>
              </svg>
            </h2>
          </a>
        </div>
        <p>
          You can interact with the API through HTTP requests from any language,
          via our official Python bindings, our official Node.js library, or a
          <a href="/docs/libraries/community-libraries"
            >community-maintained library</a
          >.
        </p>
        <p>
          To install the official Python bindings, run the following command:
        </p>
        <div class="code-sample code-sample-oneliner">
          <div class="code-sample-body code-sample-body-large">
            <button
              type="button"
              tabindex="0"
              class="btn btn-sm btn-minimal btn-neutral code-sample-copy-float"
              aria-label="Copy"
            >
              <span class="btn-label-wrap"
                ><span class="btn-node start-node"
                  ><svg
                    xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
                    width="18px"
                    height="18px"
                    fill="currentColor"
                    viewBox="0 0 24 24"
                  >
                    <path
                      fill-rule="evenodd"
                      d="M7 5a3 3 0 0 1 3-3h9a3 3 0 0 1 3 3v9a3 3 0 0 1-3 3h-2v2a3 3 0 0 1-3 3H5a3 3 0 0 1-3-3v-9a3 3 0 0 1 3-3h2V5Zm2 2h5a3 3 0 0 1 3 3v5h2a1 1 0 0 0 1-1V5a1 1 0 0 0-1-1h-9a1 1 0 0 0-1 1v2ZM5 9a1 1 0 0 0-1 1v9a1 1 0 0 0 1 1h9a1 1 0 0 0 1-1v-9a1 1 0 0 0-1-1H5Z"
                      clip-rule="evenodd"
                    ></path></svg></span
              ></span>
            </button>
            <pre
              class="hljs syntax-highlighter dark code-sample-pre"
            ><code class="language-bash" style="white-space: pre;"><span class=""><span class="">pip install openai</span></span></code></pre>
          </div>
        </div>
        <p>
          To install the official Node.js library, run the following command in
          your Node.js project directory:
        </p>
        <div class="code-sample code-sample-oneliner">
          <div class="code-sample-body code-sample-body-large">
            <button
              type="button"
              tabindex="0"
              class="btn btn-sm btn-minimal btn-neutral code-sample-copy-float"
              aria-label="Copy"
            >
              <span class="btn-label-wrap"
                ><span class="btn-node start-node"
                  ><svg
                    xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
                    width="18px"
                    height="18px"
                    fill="currentColor"
                    viewBox="0 0 24 24"
                  >
                    <path
                      fill-rule="evenodd"
                      d="M7 5a3 3 0 0 1 3-3h9a3 3 0 0 1 3 3v9a3 3 0 0 1-3 3h-2v2a3 3 0 0 1-3 3H5a3 3 0 0 1-3-3v-9a3 3 0 0 1 3-3h2V5Zm2 2h5a3 3 0 0 1 3 3v5h2a1 1 0 0 0 1-1V5a1 1 0 0 0-1-1h-9a1 1 0 0 0-1 1v2ZM5 9a1 1 0 0 0-1 1v9a1 1 0 0 0 1 1h9a1 1 0 0 0 1-1v-9a1 1 0 0 0-1-1H5Z"
                      clip-rule="evenodd"
                    ></path></svg></span
              ></span>
            </button>
            <pre
              class="hljs syntax-highlighter dark code-sample-pre"
            ><code class="language-bash" style="white-space: pre;"><span class=""><span class="">npm install openai@^4.0.0</span></span></code></pre>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div class="section md">
      <div class="markdown-content">
        <div class="anchor-heading-root">
          <a
            class="anchor-heading-link"
            href="/docs/api-reference/authentication"
          >
            <h2 class="anchor-heading" data-name="authentication">
              Authentication<svg
                stroke="currentColor"
                fill="currentColor"
                stroke-width="0"
                viewBox="0 0 20 20"
                aria-hidden="true"
                class="anchor-heading-icon"
                height="15px"
                width="15px"
                xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
              >
                <path
                  fill-rule="evenodd"
                  d="M12.586 4.586a2 2 0 112.828 2.828l-3 3a2 2 0 01-2.828 0 1 1 0 00-1.414 1.414 4 4 0 005.656 0l3-3a4 4 0 00-5.656-5.656l-1.5 1.5a1 1 0 101.414 1.414l1.5-1.5zm-5 5a2 2 0 012.828 0 1 1 0 101.414-1.414 4 4 0 00-5.656 0l-3 3a4 4 0 105.656 5.656l1.5-1.5a1 1 0 10-1.414-1.414l-1.5 1.5a2 2 0 11-2.828-2.828l3-3z"
                  clip-rule="evenodd"
                ></path>
              </svg>
            </h2>
          </a>
        </div>
        <p>
          The OpenAI API uses API keys for authentication. Visit your
          <a href="/account/api-keys">API Keys</a> page to retrieve the API key
          you'll use in your requests.
        </p>
        <p>
          <strong>Remember that your API key is a secret!</strong> Do not share
          it with others or expose it in any client-side code (browsers, apps).
          Production requests must be routed through your own backend server
          where your API key can be securely loaded from an environment variable
          or key management service.
        </p>
        <p>
          All API requests should include your API key in an
          <code>Authorization</code> HTTP header as follows:
        </p>
        <div class="code-sample code-sample-oneliner">
          <div class="code-sample-body code-sample-body-large">
            <button
              type="button"
              tabindex="0"
              class="btn btn-sm btn-minimal btn-neutral code-sample-copy-float"
              aria-label="Copy"
            >
              <span class="btn-label-wrap"
                ><span class="btn-node start-node"
                  ><svg
                    xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
                    width="18px"
                    height="18px"
                    fill="currentColor"
                    viewBox="0 0 24 24"
                  >
                    <path
                      fill-rule="evenodd"
                      d="M7 5a3 3 0 0 1 3-3h9a3 3 0 0 1 3 3v9a3 3 0 0 1-3 3h-2v2a3 3 0 0 1-3 3H5a3 3 0 0 1-3-3v-9a3 3 0 0 1 3-3h2V5Zm2 2h5a3 3 0 0 1 3 3v5h2a1 1 0 0 0 1-1V5a1 1 0 0 0-1-1h-9a1 1 0 0 0-1 1v2ZM5 9a1 1 0 0 0-1 1v9a1 1 0 0 0 1 1h9a1 1 0 0 0 1-1v-9a1 1 0 0 0-1-1H5Z"
                      clip-rule="evenodd"
                    ></path></svg></span
              ></span>
            </button>
            <pre
              class="hljs syntax-highlighter dark code-sample-pre"
            ><code class="language-bash" style="white-space: pre;"><span class=""><span class="">Authorization: Bearer OPENAI_API_KEY</span></span></code></pre>
          </div>
        </div>
        <div class="anchor-heading-root">
          <a
            class="anchor-heading-link"
            href="/docs/api-reference/organization-optional"
          >
            <h3 class="anchor-heading" data-name="organization-optional">
              Organization (optional)<svg
                stroke="currentColor"
                fill="currentColor"
                stroke-width="0"
                viewBox="0 0 20 20"
                aria-hidden="true"
                class="anchor-heading-icon"
                height="15px"
                width="15px"
                xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
              >
                <path
                  fill-rule="evenodd"
                  d="M12.586 4.586a2 2 0 112.828 2.828l-3 3a2 2 0 01-2.828 0 1 1 0 00-1.414 1.414 4 4 0 005.656 0l3-3a4 4 0 00-5.656-5.656l-1.5 1.5a1 1 0 101.414 1.414l1.5-1.5zm-5 5a2 2 0 012.828 0 1 1 0 101.414-1.414 4 4 0 00-5.656 0l-3 3a4 4 0 105.656 5.656l1.5-1.5a1 1 0 10-1.414-1.414l-1.5 1.5a2 2 0 11-2.828-2.828l3-3z"
                  clip-rule="evenodd"
                ></path>
              </svg>
            </h3>
          </a>
        </div>
        <p>
          For users who belong to multiple organizations, you can pass a header
          to specify which organization is used for an API request. Usage from
          these API requests will count as usage for the specified organization.
        </p>
        <p>Example curl command:</p>
        <div class="code-sample">
          <div class="code-sample-body code-sample-body-large">
            <button
              type="button"
              tabindex="0"
              class="btn btn-sm btn-minimal btn-neutral code-sample-copy-float"
              aria-label="Copy"
            >
              <span class="btn-label-wrap"
                ><span class="btn-node start-node"
                  ><svg
                    xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
                    width="18px"
                    height="18px"
                    fill="currentColor"
                    viewBox="0 0 24 24"
                  >
                    <path
                      fill-rule="evenodd"
                      d="M7 5a3 3 0 0 1 3-3h9a3 3 0 0 1 3 3v9a3 3 0 0 1-3 3h-2v2a3 3 0 0 1-3 3H5a3 3 0 0 1-3-3v-9a3 3 0 0 1 3-3h2V5Zm2 2h5a3 3 0 0 1 3 3v5h2a1 1 0 0 0 1-1V5a1 1 0 0 0-1-1h-9a1 1 0 0 0-1 1v2ZM5 9a1 1 0 0 0-1 1v9a1 1 0 0 0 1 1h9a1 1 0 0 0 1-1v-9a1 1 0 0 0-1-1H5Z"
                      clip-rule="evenodd"
                    ></path></svg></span
              ></span>
            </button>
            <pre
              class="hljs syntax-highlighter dark code-sample-pre"
            ><code class="language-bash" style="white-space: pre;"><code><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">1
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">2
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">3
</span></code><span class=""><span class="">curl https://api.openai.com/v1/models \
</span></span><span class=""><span class="">  -H </span><span class="hljs-string">"Authorization: Bearer </span><span class="hljs-string hljs-variable">$OPENAI_API_KEY</span><span class="hljs-string">"</span><span class=""> \
</span></span><span class=""><span class="">  -H </span><span class="hljs-string">"OpenAI-Organization: YOUR_ORG_ID"</span></span></code></pre>
          </div>
        </div>
        <p>Example with the <code>openai</code> Python package:</p>
        <div class="code-sample">
          <div class="code-sample-body code-sample-body-large">
            <button
              type="button"
              tabindex="0"
              class="btn btn-sm btn-minimal btn-neutral code-sample-copy-float"
              aria-label="Copy"
            >
              <span class="btn-label-wrap"
                ><span class="btn-node start-node"
                  ><svg
                    xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
                    width="18px"
                    height="18px"
                    fill="currentColor"
                    viewBox="0 0 24 24"
                  >
                    <path
                      fill-rule="evenodd"
                      d="M7 5a3 3 0 0 1 3-3h9a3 3 0 0 1 3 3v9a3 3 0 0 1-3 3h-2v2a3 3 0 0 1-3 3H5a3 3 0 0 1-3-3v-9a3 3 0 0 1 3-3h2V5Zm2 2h5a3 3 0 0 1 3 3v5h2a1 1 0 0 0 1-1V5a1 1 0 0 0-1-1h-9a1 1 0 0 0-1 1v2ZM5 9a1 1 0 0 0-1 1v9a1 1 0 0 0 1 1h9a1 1 0 0 0 1-1v-9a1 1 0 0 0-1-1H5Z"
                      clip-rule="evenodd"
                    ></path></svg></span
              ></span>
            </button>
            <pre
              class="hljs syntax-highlighter dark code-sample-pre"
            ><code class="language-python" style="white-space: pre;"><code><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">1
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">2
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">3
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">4
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">5
</span></code><span class=""><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span><span class=""> openai </span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span><span class=""> OpenAI
</span></span><span class="">
</span><span class="">client = OpenAI(
</span><span class=""><span class="">  organization=</span><span class="hljs-string">'YOUR_ORG_ID'</span><span class="">,
</span></span><span class="">)</span></code></pre>
          </div>
        </div>
        <p>Example with the <code>openai</code> Node.js package:</p>
        <div class="code-sample">
          <div class="code-sample-body code-sample-body-large">
            <button
              type="button"
              tabindex="0"
              class="btn btn-sm btn-minimal btn-neutral code-sample-copy-float"
              aria-label="Copy"
            >
              <span class="btn-label-wrap"
                ><span class="btn-node start-node"
                  ><svg
                    xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
                    width="18px"
                    height="18px"
                    fill="currentColor"
                    viewBox="0 0 24 24"
                  >
                    <path
                      fill-rule="evenodd"
                      d="M7 5a3 3 0 0 1 3-3h9a3 3 0 0 1 3 3v9a3 3 0 0 1-3 3h-2v2a3 3 0 0 1-3 3H5a3 3 0 0 1-3-3v-9a3 3 0 0 1 3-3h2V5Zm2 2h5a3 3 0 0 1 3 3v5h2a1 1 0 0 0 1-1V5a1 1 0 0 0-1-1h-9a1 1 0 0 0-1 1v2ZM5 9a1 1 0 0 0-1 1v9a1 1 0 0 0 1 1h9a1 1 0 0 0 1-1v-9a1 1 0 0 0-1-1H5Z"
                      clip-rule="evenodd"
                    ></path></svg></span
              ></span>
            </button>
            <pre
              class="hljs syntax-highlighter dark code-sample-pre"
            ><code class="language-javascript" style="white-space: pre;"><code><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">1
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">2
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">3
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">4
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">5
</span></code><span class=""><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span><span class=""> OpenAI </span><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span><span class=""> </span><span class="hljs-string">"openai"</span><span class="">;
</span></span><span class="">
</span><span class=""><span class=""></span><span class="hljs-keyword">const</span><span class=""> openai = </span><span class="hljs-keyword">new</span><span class=""> OpenAI({
</span></span><span class=""><span class="">  </span><span class="hljs-attr">organization</span><span class="">: </span><span class="hljs-string">'YOUR_ORG_ID'</span><span class="">,
</span></span><span class="">});</span></code></pre>
          </div>
        </div>
        <p>
          Organization IDs can be found on your
          <a href="/account/organization">Organization settings</a> page.
        </p>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div class="section md">
      <div class="markdown-content">
        <div class="anchor-heading-root">
          <a
            class="anchor-heading-link"
            href="/docs/api-reference/making-requests"
          >
            <h2 class="anchor-heading" data-name="making-requests">
              Making requests<svg
                stroke="currentColor"
                fill="currentColor"
                stroke-width="0"
                viewBox="0 0 20 20"
                aria-hidden="true"
                class="anchor-heading-icon"
                height="15px"
                width="15px"
                xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
              >
                <path
                  fill-rule="evenodd"
                  d="M12.586 4.586a2 2 0 112.828 2.828l-3 3a2 2 0 01-2.828 0 1 1 0 00-1.414 1.414 4 4 0 005.656 0l3-3a4 4 0 00-5.656-5.656l-1.5 1.5a1 1 0 101.414 1.414l1.5-1.5zm-5 5a2 2 0 012.828 0 1 1 0 101.414-1.414 4 4 0 00-5.656 0l-3 3a4 4 0 105.656 5.656l1.5-1.5a1 1 0 10-1.414-1.414l-1.5 1.5a2 2 0 11-2.828-2.828l3-3z"
                  clip-rule="evenodd"
                ></path>
              </svg>
            </h2>
          </a>
        </div>
        <p>
          You can paste the command below into your terminal to run your first
          API request. Make sure to replace <code>$OPENAI_API_KEY</code> with
          your secret API key.
        </p>
        <div class="code-sample">
          <div class="code-sample-body code-sample-body-large">
            <button
              type="button"
              tabindex="0"
              class="btn btn-sm btn-minimal btn-neutral code-sample-copy-float"
              aria-label="Copy"
            >
              <span class="btn-label-wrap"
                ><span class="btn-node start-node"
                  ><svg
                    xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
                    width="18px"
                    height="18px"
                    fill="currentColor"
                    viewBox="0 0 24 24"
                  >
                    <path
                      fill-rule="evenodd"
                      d="M7 5a3 3 0 0 1 3-3h9a3 3 0 0 1 3 3v9a3 3 0 0 1-3 3h-2v2a3 3 0 0 1-3 3H5a3 3 0 0 1-3-3v-9a3 3 0 0 1 3-3h2V5Zm2 2h5a3 3 0 0 1 3 3v5h2a1 1 0 0 0 1-1V5a1 1 0 0 0-1-1h-9a1 1 0 0 0-1 1v2ZM5 9a1 1 0 0 0-1 1v9a1 1 0 0 0 1 1h9a1 1 0 0 0 1-1v-9a1 1 0 0 0-1-1H5Z"
                      clip-rule="evenodd"
                    ></path></svg></span
              ></span>
            </button>
            <pre
              class="hljs syntax-highlighter dark code-sample-pre"
            ><code class="language-bash" style="white-space: pre;"><code><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">1
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">2
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">3
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">4
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">5
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">6
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">7
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">8
</span></code><span class=""><span class="">curl https://api.openai.com/v1/chat/completions \
</span></span><span class=""><span class="">  -H </span><span class="hljs-string">"Content-Type: application/json"</span><span class=""> \
</span></span><span class=""><span class="">  -H </span><span class="hljs-string">"Authorization: Bearer </span><span class="hljs-string hljs-variable">$OPENAI_API_KEY</span><span class="hljs-string">"</span><span class=""> \
</span></span><span class=""><span class="">  -d </span><span class="hljs-string">'{
</span></span><span class="hljs-string">     "model": "gpt-3.5-turbo",
</span><span class="hljs-string">     "messages": [{"role": "user", "content": "Say this is a test!"}],
</span><span class="hljs-string">     "temperature": 0.7
</span><span class="hljs-string">   }'</span></code></pre>
          </div>
        </div>
        <p>
          This request queries the <code>gpt-3.5-turbo</code> model (which under
          the hood points to a
          <a href="/docs/models/gpt-3-5-turbo"
            ><code>gpt-3.5-turbo</code> model variant</a
          >) to complete the text starting with a prompt of "<em
            >Say this is a test</em
          >". You should get a response back that resembles the following:
        </p>
        <div class="code-sample">
          <div class="code-sample-body code-sample-body-large">
            <button
              type="button"
              tabindex="0"
              class="btn btn-sm btn-minimal btn-neutral code-sample-copy-float"
              aria-label="Copy"
            >
              <span class="btn-label-wrap"
                ><span class="btn-node start-node"
                  ><svg
                    xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
                    width="18px"
                    height="18px"
                    fill="currentColor"
                    viewBox="0 0 24 24"
                  >
                    <path
                      fill-rule="evenodd"
                      d="M7 5a3 3 0 0 1 3-3h9a3 3 0 0 1 3 3v9a3 3 0 0 1-3 3h-2v2a3 3 0 0 1-3 3H5a3 3 0 0 1-3-3v-9a3 3 0 0 1 3-3h2V5Zm2 2h5a3 3 0 0 1 3 3v5h2a1 1 0 0 0 1-1V5a1 1 0 0 0-1-1h-9a1 1 0 0 0-1 1v2ZM5 9a1 1 0 0 0-1 1v9a1 1 0 0 0 1 1h9a1 1 0 0 0 1-1v-9a1 1 0 0 0-1-1H5Z"
                      clip-rule="evenodd"
                    ></path></svg></span
              ></span>
            </button>
            <pre
              class="hljs syntax-highlighter dark code-sample-pre"
            ><code class="language-json" style="white-space: pre;"><code><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">1
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">2
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">3
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">4
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">5
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">6
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">7
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">8
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">9
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">10
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">11
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">12
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">13
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">14
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">15
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">16
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">17
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">18
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">19
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">20
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">21
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">22
</span></code><span class=""><span class="">{
</span></span><span class=""><span class="">    </span><span class="hljs-string">"id"</span><span class="">: </span><span class="hljs-string">"chatcmpl-abc123"</span><span class="">,
</span></span><span class=""><span class="">    </span><span class="hljs-string">"object"</span><span class="">: </span><span class="hljs-string">"chat.completion"</span><span class="">,
</span></span><span class=""><span class="">    </span><span class="hljs-string">"created"</span><span class="">: </span><span class="hljs-number">1677858242</span><span class="">,
</span></span><span class=""><span class="">    </span><span class="hljs-string">"model"</span><span class="">: </span><span class="hljs-string">"gpt-3.5-turbo-0613"</span><span class="">,
</span></span><span class=""><span class="">    </span><span class="hljs-string">"usage"</span><span class="">: {
</span></span><span class=""><span class="">        </span><span class="hljs-string">"prompt_tokens"</span><span class="">: </span><span class="hljs-number">13</span><span class="">,
</span></span><span class=""><span class="">        </span><span class="hljs-string">"completion_tokens"</span><span class="">: </span><span class="hljs-number">7</span><span class="">,
</span></span><span class=""><span class="">        </span><span class="hljs-string">"total_tokens"</span><span class="">: </span><span class="hljs-number">20</span><span class="">
</span></span><span class="">    },
</span><span class=""><span class="">    </span><span class="hljs-string">"choices"</span><span class="">: [
</span></span><span class="">        {
</span><span class=""><span class="">            </span><span class="hljs-string">"message"</span><span class="">: {
</span></span><span class=""><span class="">                </span><span class="hljs-string">"role"</span><span class="">: </span><span class="hljs-string">"assistant"</span><span class="">,
</span></span><span class=""><span class="">                </span><span class="hljs-string">"content"</span><span class="">: </span><span class="hljs-string">"\n\nThis is a test!"</span><span class="">
</span></span><span class="">            },
</span><span class=""><span class="">            </span><span class="hljs-string">"logprobs"</span><span class="">: </span><span class="hljs-literal">null</span><span class="">,
</span></span><span class=""><span class="">            </span><span class="hljs-string">"finish_reason"</span><span class="">: </span><span class="hljs-string">"stop"</span><span class="">,
</span></span><span class=""><span class="">            </span><span class="hljs-string">"index"</span><span class="">: </span><span class="hljs-number">0</span><span class="">
</span></span><span class="">        }
</span><span class="">    ]
</span><span class="">}</span></code></pre>
          </div>
        </div>
        <p>
          Now that you've generated your first chat completion, let's break down
          the <a href="/docs/api-reference/chat/object">response object</a>. We
          can see the <code>finish_reason</code> is <code>stop</code> which
          means the API returned the full chat completion generated by the model
          without running into any limits. In the choices list, we only
          generated a single message but you can set the
          <code>n</code> parameter to generate multiple messages choices.
        </p>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div class="section md">
      <div class="markdown-content">
        <div class="anchor-heading-root">
          <a class="anchor-heading-link" href="/docs/api-reference/streaming">
            <h2 class="anchor-heading" data-name="streaming">
              Streaming<svg
                stroke="currentColor"
                fill="currentColor"
                stroke-width="0"
                viewBox="0 0 20 20"
                aria-hidden="true"
                class="anchor-heading-icon"
                height="15px"
                width="15px"
                xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
              >
                <path
                  fill-rule="evenodd"
                  d="M12.586 4.586a2 2 0 112.828 2.828l-3 3a2 2 0 01-2.828 0 1 1 0 00-1.414 1.414 4 4 0 005.656 0l3-3a4 4 0 00-5.656-5.656l-1.5 1.5a1 1 0 101.414 1.414l1.5-1.5zm-5 5a2 2 0 012.828 0 1 1 0 101.414-1.414 4 4 0 00-5.656 0l-3 3a4 4 0 105.656 5.656l1.5-1.5a1 1 0 10-1.414-1.414l-1.5 1.5a2 2 0 11-2.828-2.828l3-3z"
                  clip-rule="evenodd"
                ></path>
              </svg>
            </h2>
          </a>
        </div>
        <p>
          The OpenAI API provides the ability to stream responses back to a
          client in order to allow partial results for certain requests. To
          achieve this, we follow the
          <a
            href="https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/server-sent-events.html#server-sent-events"
            target="_blank"
            rel="noopener noreferrer"
            >Server-sent events</a
          >
          standard.
        </p>
        <p>
          Our official
          <a
            href="https://github.com/openai/openai-node"
            target="_blank"
            rel="noopener noreferrer"
            >Node</a
          >
          and
          <a
            href="https://github.com/openai/openai-python"
            target="_blank"
            rel="noopener noreferrer"
            >Python</a
          >
          libraries handle Server-sent events for you. In Python, a streaming
          request looks like:
        </p>
        <div class="code-sample">
          <div class="code-sample-body code-sample-body-large">
            <button
              type="button"
              tabindex="0"
              class="btn btn-sm btn-minimal btn-neutral code-sample-copy-float"
              aria-label="Copy"
            >
              <span class="btn-label-wrap"
                ><span class="btn-node start-node"
                  ><svg
                    xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
                    width="18px"
                    height="18px"
                    fill="currentColor"
                    viewBox="0 0 24 24"
                  >
                    <path
                      fill-rule="evenodd"
                      d="M7 5a3 3 0 0 1 3-3h9a3 3 0 0 1 3 3v9a3 3 0 0 1-3 3h-2v2a3 3 0 0 1-3 3H5a3 3 0 0 1-3-3v-9a3 3 0 0 1 3-3h2V5Zm2 2h5a3 3 0 0 1 3 3v5h2a1 1 0 0 0 1-1V5a1 1 0 0 0-1-1h-9a1 1 0 0 0-1 1v2ZM5 9a1 1 0 0 0-1 1v9a1 1 0 0 0 1 1h9a1 1 0 0 0 1-1v-9a1 1 0 0 0-1-1H5Z"
                      clip-rule="evenodd"
                    ></path></svg></span
              ></span>
            </button>
            <pre
              class="hljs syntax-highlighter dark code-sample-pre"
            ><code class="language-python" style="white-space: pre;"><code><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">1
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">2
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">3
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">4
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">5
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">6
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">7
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">8
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">9
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">10
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">11
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">12
</span></code><span class=""><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span><span class=""> openai </span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span><span class=""> OpenAI
</span></span><span class="">
</span><span class="">client = OpenAI()
</span><span class="">
</span><span class="">stream = client.chat.completions.create(
</span><span class=""><span class="">    model=</span><span class="hljs-string">"gpt-4"</span><span class="">,
</span></span><span class=""><span class="">    messages=[{</span><span class="hljs-string">"role"</span><span class="">: </span><span class="hljs-string">"user"</span><span class="">, </span><span class="hljs-string">"content"</span><span class="">: </span><span class="hljs-string">"Say this is a test"</span><span class="">}],
</span></span><span class=""><span class="">    stream=</span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="">,
</span></span><span class="">)
</span><span class=""><span class=""></span><span class="hljs-keyword">for</span><span class=""> chunk </span><span class="hljs-keyword">in</span><span class=""> stream:
</span></span><span class=""><span class="">    </span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span><span class=""> chunk.choices[</span><span class="hljs-number">0</span><span class="">].delta.content </span><span class="hljs-keyword">is</span><span class=""> </span><span class="hljs-keyword">not</span><span class=""> </span><span class="hljs-literal">None</span><span class="">:
</span></span><span class=""><span class="">        </span><span class="hljs-built_in">print</span><span class="">(chunk.choices[</span><span class="hljs-number">0</span><span class="">].delta.content, end=</span><span class="hljs-string">""</span><span class="">)</span></span></code></pre>
          </div>
        </div>
        <p>In Node / Typescript, a streaming request looks like:</p>
        <div class="code-sample">
          <div class="code-sample-body code-sample-body-large">
            <button
              type="button"
              tabindex="0"
              class="btn btn-sm btn-minimal btn-neutral code-sample-copy-float"
              aria-label="Copy"
            >
              <span class="btn-label-wrap"
                ><span class="btn-node start-node"
                  ><svg
                    xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
                    width="18px"
                    height="18px"
                    fill="currentColor"
                    viewBox="0 0 24 24"
                  >
                    <path
                      fill-rule="evenodd"
                      d="M7 5a3 3 0 0 1 3-3h9a3 3 0 0 1 3 3v9a3 3 0 0 1-3 3h-2v2a3 3 0 0 1-3 3H5a3 3 0 0 1-3-3v-9a3 3 0 0 1 3-3h2V5Zm2 2h5a3 3 0 0 1 3 3v5h2a1 1 0 0 0 1-1V5a1 1 0 0 0-1-1h-9a1 1 0 0 0-1 1v2ZM5 9a1 1 0 0 0-1 1v9a1 1 0 0 0 1 1h9a1 1 0 0 0 1-1v-9a1 1 0 0 0-1-1H5Z"
                      clip-rule="evenodd"
                    ></path></svg></span
              ></span>
            </button>
            <pre
              class="hljs syntax-highlighter dark code-sample-pre"
            ><code class="language-javascript" style="white-space: pre;"><code><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">1
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">2
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">3
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">4
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">5
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">6
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">7
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">8
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">9
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">10
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">11
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">12
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">13
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">14
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">15
</span><span class="react-syntax-highlighter-line-number">16
</span></code><span class=""><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span><span class=""> OpenAI </span><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span><span class=""> </span><span class="hljs-string">"openai"</span><span class="">;
</span></span><span class="">
</span><span class=""><span class=""></span><span class="hljs-keyword">const</span><span class=""> openai = </span><span class="hljs-keyword">new</span><span class=""> OpenAI();
</span></span><span class="">
</span><span class=""><span class=""></span><span class="hljs-keyword">async</span><span class=""> </span><span class="hljs-function hljs-keyword">function</span><span class="hljs-function"> </span><span class="hljs-function hljs-title">main</span><span class="hljs-function">(</span><span class="hljs-function">) </span><span class="">{
</span></span><span class=""><span class="">    </span><span class="hljs-keyword">const</span><span class=""> stream = </span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span><span class=""> openai.chat.completions.create({
</span></span><span class=""><span class="">        </span><span class="hljs-attr">model</span><span class="">: </span><span class="hljs-string">"gpt-4"</span><span class="">,
</span></span><span class=""><span class="">        </span><span class="hljs-attr">messages</span><span class="">: [{ </span><span class="hljs-attr">role</span><span class="">: </span><span class="hljs-string">"user"</span><span class="">, </span><span class="hljs-attr">content</span><span class="">: </span><span class="hljs-string">"Say this is a test"</span><span class=""> }],
</span></span><span class=""><span class="">        </span><span class="hljs-attr">stream</span><span class="">: </span><span class="hljs-literal">true</span><span class="">,
</span></span><span class="">    });
</span><span class=""><span class="">    </span><span class="hljs-keyword">for</span><span class=""> </span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span><span class=""> (</span><span class="hljs-keyword">const</span><span class=""> chunk </span><span class="hljs-keyword">of</span><span class=""> stream) {
</span></span><span class=""><span class="">        process.stdout.write(chunk.choices[</span><span class="hljs-number">0</span><span class="">]?.delta?.content || </span><span class="hljs-string">""</span><span class="">);
</span></span><span class="">    }
</span><span class="">}
</span><span class="">
</span><span class="">main();</span></code></pre>
          </div>
        </div>
        <div class="anchor-heading-root">
          <a
            class="anchor-heading-link"
            href="/docs/api-reference/parsing-server-sent-events"
          >
            <h4 class="anchor-heading" data-name="parsing-server-sent-events">
              Parsing Server-sent events<svg
                stroke="currentColor"
                fill="currentColor"
                stroke-width="0"
                viewBox="0 0 20 20"
                aria-hidden="true"
                class="anchor-heading-icon"
                height="15px"
                width="15px"
                xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
              >
                <path
                  fill-rule="evenodd"
                  d="M12.586 4.586a2 2 0 112.828 2.828l-3 3a2 2 0 01-2.828 0 1 1 0 00-1.414 1.414 4 4 0 005.656 0l3-3a4 4 0 00-5.656-5.656l-1.5 1.5a1 1 0 101.414 1.414l1.5-1.5zm-5 5a2 2 0 012.828 0 1 1 0 101.414-1.414 4 4 0 00-5.656 0l-3 3a4 4 0 105.656 5.656l1.5-1.5a1 1 0 10-1.414-1.414l-1.5 1.5a2 2 0 11-2.828-2.828l3-3z"
                  clip-rule="evenodd"
                ></path>
              </svg>
            </h4>
          </a>
        </div>
        <p>
          Parsing Server-sent events is non-trivial and should be done with
          caution. Simple strategies like splitting by a new line may result in
          parsing errors. We recommend using
          <a href="/docs/libraries">existing client libraries</a> when possible.
        </p>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div class="section md">
      <div class="anchor-heading-root">

    <div class="section endpoint">
      <div class="section-left">
        <div class="anchor-heading-root">
          <a

          >
            <h2 class="anchor-heading" data-name="audio/createSpeech">
              Create speech<svg

                fill="currentColor"
                stroke-width="0"
                viewBox="0 0 20 20"
                aria-hidden="true"
                class="anchor-heading-icon"
                height="15px"
                width="15px"
                xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
              >
                <path
                  fill-rule="evenodd"
                  d="M12.586 4.586a2 2 0 112.828 2.828l-3 3a2 2 0 01-2.828 0 1 1 0 00-1.414 1.414 4 4 0 005.656 0l3-3a4 4 0 00-5.656-5.656l-1.5 1.5a1 1 0 101.414 1.414l1.5-1.5zm-5 5a2 2 0 012.828 0 1 1 0 101.414-1.414 4 4 0 00-5.656 0l-3 3a4 4 0 105.656 5.656l1.5-1.5a1 1 0 10-1.414-1.414l-1.5 1.5a2 2 0 11-2.828-2.828l3-3z"

              >https://api.openai.com/v1/audio/speech</span

        </p>
        <div class="endpoint-summary">

        <div class="param-section">

                  <p>
                    An object specifying the format that the model must output.
                    Compatible with
                    <a href="/docs/models/gpt-4-and-gpt-4-turbo">GPT-4 Turbo</a>
                    and all GPT-3.5 Turbo models newer than
                    <code>gpt-3.5-turbo-1106</code>.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                    Setting to <code>{ "type": "json_object" }</code> enables
                    JSON mode, which guarantees the message the model generates
                    is valid JSON.
                  </p>

                    <strong>must</strong> also instruct the model to produce
                    JSON yourself via a system or user message. Without this,
                    the model may generate an unending stream of whitespace

                    long-running and seemingly "stuck" request. Also note that
                    the message content may be partially cut off if
                    <code>finish_reason="length"</code>, which indicates the
                    generation exceeded <code>max_tokens</code> or the
                    conversation exceeded the max context length.

                    ChatGPT. Tokens will be sent as data-only

                      rel="noopener noreferrer"

                    >
                    as they become available, with the stream terminated by a
                    <code>data: [DONE]</code> message.
                    <a
                      href="https://cookbook.openai.com/examples/how_to_stream_completions"
                      target="_blank"
                      rel="noopener noreferrer"

                <div class="param-name">temperature</div>

                <div class="param-default">Defaults to 1</div>

              <div class="param-desc">
                <div class="markdown-content">
                  <p>
                    What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher
                    values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while
                    lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and
                    deterministic.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                    We generally recommend altering this or
                    <code>top_p</code> but not both.
                  </p>

                      clip-rule="evenodd"

                <div class="param-default">Defaults to 1</div>

              <div class="param-desc">
                <div class="markdown-content">
                  <p>
                    An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus
                    sampling, where the model considers the results of the
                    tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the

                    considered.

                  <p>
                    We generally recommend altering this or
                    <code>temperature</code> but not both.

            the provided input.
          </p>

                      be <code>stop</code> if the model hit a natural stop point

                      maximum number of tokens specified in the request was

                      be <code>stop</code> if the model hit a natural stop point
                      or a provided stop sequence, <code>length</code> if the
                      maximum number of tokens specified in the request was
                      reached, <code>content_filter</code> if content was
                      omitted due to a flag from our content filters,
                      <code>tool_calls</code> if the model called a tool, or
                      <code>function_call</code> (deprecated) if the model
                      called a function.

        <a class="anchor-heading-link" href="/docs/api-reference/embeddings">
          <h2 class="anchor-heading" data-name="embeddings">
            Embeddings<svg
              stroke="currentColor"
              fill="currentColor"
              stroke-width="0"
              viewBox="0 0 20 20"
              aria-hidden="true"
              class="anchor-heading-icon"
              height="15px"

              <path

                clip-rule="evenodd"

          </h2>
        </a>
      </div>
      <div class="markdown-content">
        <p>
          Get a vector representation of a given input that can be easily
          consumed by machine learning models and algorithms.
        </p>
        <p>Related guide: <a href="/docs/guides/embeddings">Embeddings</a></p>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div class="section endpoint">
      <div class="section-left">
        <div class="anchor-heading-root">
          <a
            class="anchor-heading-link"
            href="/docs/api-reference/embeddings/create"
          >
            <h2 class="anchor-heading" data-name="embeddings/create">
              Create embeddings<svg
                stroke="currentColor"
                fill="currentColor"
                stroke-width="0"
                viewBox="0 0 20 20"
                aria-hidden="true"
                class="anchor-heading-icon"
                height="15px"

              >
                <path
                  fill-rule="evenodd"
                  d="M12.586 4.586a2 2 0 112.828 2.828l-3 3a2 2 0 01-2.828 0 1 1 0 00-1.414 1.414 4 4 0 005.656 0l3-3a4 4 0 00-5.656-5.656l-1.5 1.5a1 1 0 101.414 1.414l1.5-1.5zm-5 5a2 2 0 012.828 0 1 1 0 101.414-1.414 4 4 0 00-5.656 0l-3 3a4 4 0 105.656 5.656l1.5-1.5a1 1 0 10-1.414-1.414l-1.5 1.5a2 2 0 11-2.828-2.828l3-3z"

              </svg>
            </h2>
          </a>
        </div>
        <p>
          <span class="endpoint-text"
            ><span class="endpoint-method endpoint-method-post">post</span
            >&nbsp;<span class="endpoint-path"
              >https://api.openai.com/v1/embeddings</span
            ></span
          >
        </p>
        <div class="endpoint-summary">
          <p>Creates an embedding vector representing the input text.</p>
        </div>
        <div class="param-section">
          <h3>Request body</h3>
          <div class="param-table" id="embeddings-create__table">
            <div class="param-row">
              <div class="param-row-header api-ref-anchor-link-hover">
                <a
                  href="#embeddings-create-input"
                  data-anchor="embeddings-create-input"
                  class="api-ref-anchor-link"
                  ><svg
                    xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
                    width="1em"
                    height="1em"
                    fill="currentColor"
                    viewBox="0 0 24 24"
                  >
                    <path
                      fill-rule="evenodd"
                      d="M18.293 5.707a4.657 4.657 0 0 0-6.586 0l-1 1a1 1 0 1 1-1.414-1.414l1-1a6.657 6.657 0 1 1 9.414 9.414l-1 1a1 1 0 0 1-1.414-1.414l1-1a4.657 4.657 0 0 0 0-6.586Zm-2.586 2.586a1 1 0 0 1 0 1.414l-6 6a1 1 0 0 1-1.414-1.414l6-6a1 1 0 0 1 1.414 0Zm-9 1a1 1 0 0 1 0 1.414l-1 1a4.657 4.657 0 0 0 6.586 6.586l1-1a1 1 0 0 1 1.414 1.414l-1 1a6.657 6.657 0 1 1-9.414-9.414l1-1a1 1 0 0 1 1.414 0Z"
                      clip-rule="evenodd"
                    ></path></svg
                ></a>
                <div class="param-name">input</div>
                <div class="param-type">string or array</div>
                <div class="param-reqd">Required</div>
              </div>
              <div class="param-desc">
                <div class="markdown-content">
                  <p>
                    Input text to embed, encoded as a string or array of tokens.
                    To embed multiple inputs in a single request, pass an array
                    of strings or array of token arrays. The input must not
                    exceed the max input tokens for the model (8192 tokens for
                    <code>text-embedding-ada-002</code>), cannot be an empty
                    string, and any array must be 2048 dimensions or less.
                    <a
                      href="https://cookbook.openai.com/examples/how_to_count_tokens_with_tiktoken"
                      target="_blank"
                      rel="noopener noreferrer"
                      >Example Python code</a
                    >
                    for counting tokens.
                  </p>
                </div>
              </div>
              <button
                class="param-expand-button link-style"
                aria-expanded="true"
                aria-controls="embeddings-create-input_table"

                    clip-rule="evenodd"
                  ></path></svg
                ><span>Hide possible types</span>
              </button>

                    <div class="param-type">string</div>
                  </div>
                  <div class="param-desc">
                    <div class="markdown-content">
                      <p>The string that will be turned into an embedding.</p>
                    </div>
                  </div>
                </div>
                <div class="param-row">
                  <div class="param-row-header api-ref-anchor-link-hover">
                    <div class="param-title">array</div>
                    <div class="param-type">array</div>
                  </div>
                  <div class="param-desc">
                    <div class="markdown-content">
                      <p>
                        The array of strings that will be turned into an

                      </p>
                    </div>
                  </div>
                </div>
                <div class="param-row">
                  <div class="param-row-header api-ref-anchor-link-hover">
                    <div class="param-title">array</div>
                    <div class="param-type">array</div>
                  </div>
                  <div class="param-desc">
                    <div class="markdown-content">
                      <p>
                        The array of integers that will be turned into an

                    </div>
                  </div>
                </div>
                <div class="param-row">
                  <div class="param-row-header api-ref-anchor-link-hover">

                  <div class="param-desc">
                    <div class="markdown-content">

                  </div>
                </div>

          data.
        </p>
        <p>
          Related guide: <a href="/docs/guides/fine-tuning">Fine-tune models</a>
        </p>
      </div>

        <p>
          <span class="endpoint-text"
            ><span class="endpoint-method endpoint-method-post">post</span
            >&nbsp;<span class="endpoint-path"
              >https://api.openai.com/v1/fine_tuning/jobs</span
            ></span
          >
        </p>
        <div class="endpoint-summary">
          <p>
            Creates a fine-tuning job which begins the process of creating a new
            model from a given dataset.
          </p>
          <p>
            Response includes details of the enqueued job including job status
            and the name of the fine-tuned models once complete.
          </p>
          <p>
            <a href="/docs/guides/fine-tuning">Learn more about fine-tuning</a>
          </p>

                  <p>
                    The name of the model to fine-tune. You can select one of
                    the
                    <a
                      href="/docs/guides/fine-tuning/what-models-can-be-fine-tuned"
                      >supported models</a
                    >.
                  </p>

                  </p>
                  <p>
                    Your dataset must be formatted as a JSONL file.
                    Additionally, you must upload your file with the purpose
                    <code>fine-tune</code>.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                    See the
                    <a href="/docs/guides/fine-tuning">fine-tuning guide</a> for
                    more details.

                    A string of up to 18 characters that will be added to your
                    fine-tuned model name.

                  <p>
                    For example, a <code>suffix</code> of "custom-model-name"
                    would produce a model name like
                    <code
                      >ft:gpt-3.5-turbo:openai:custom-model-name:7p4lURel</code
                    >.

                    The ID of an uploaded file that contains validation data.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                    If you provide this file, the data is used to generate
                    validation metrics periodically during fine-tuning. These
                    metrics can be viewed in the fine-tuning results file. The
                    same data should not be present in both train and validation

                  <p>
                    Your dataset must be formatted as a JSONL file. You must
                    upload your file with the purpose <code>fine-tune</code>.

              >https://api.openai.com/v1/files</span
            ></span
          >
        </p>
        <div class="endpoint-summary">
          <p>
            Upload a file that can be used across various endpoints. The size of
            all the files uploaded by one organization can be up to 100 GB.
          </p>
          <p>
            The size of individual files can be a maximum of 512 MB or 2 million
            tokens for Assistants. See the
            <a href="/docs/assistants/tools">Assistants Tools guide</a> to learn
            more about the types of files supported. The Fine-tuning API only
            supports <code>.jsonl</code> files.
          </p>
          <p>
            Please
            <a
              href="https://help.openai.com/"
              target="_blank"
              rel="noopener noreferrer"
              >contact us</a
            >
            if you need to increase these storage limits.
          </p>

            ></span
          >

        <div class="endpoint-summary">
          <p>
            When a run has the <code>status: "requires_action"</code> and
            <code>required_action.type</code> is
            <code>submit_tool_outputs</code>, this endpoint can be used to
            submit the outputs from the tool calls once they're all completed.
            All outputs must be submitted in a single request.
          </p>

    <div class="section md">
      <div class="anchor-heading-root">
        <a class="anchor-heading-link" href="/docs/api-reference/completions">
          <h2 class="anchor-heading" data-name="completions">
            Completions
            <div color="orange" class="css-pms1cx">Legacy</div>
            <svg
              stroke="currentColor"
              fill="currentColor"
              stroke-width="0"
              viewBox="0 0 20 20"
              aria-hidden="true"
              class="anchor-heading-icon"
              height="15px"
              width="15px"
              xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
            >
              <path
                fill-rule="evenodd"
                d="M12.586 4.586a2 2 0 112.828 2.828l-3 3a2 2 0 01-2.828 0 1 1 0 00-1.414 1.414 4 4 0 005.656 0l3-3a4 4 0 00-5.656-5.656l-1.5 1.5a1 1 0 101.414 1.414l1.5-1.5zm-5 5a2 2 0 012.828 0 1 1 0 101.414-1.414 4 4 0 00-5.656 0l-3 3a4 4 0 105.656 5.656l1.5-1.5a1 1 0 10-1.414-1.414l-1.5 1.5a2 2 0 11-2.828-2.828l3-3z"
                clip-rule="evenodd"
              ></path>
            </svg>
          </h2>
        </a>
      </div>
      <div class="markdown-content">
        <p>
          Given a prompt, the model will return one or more predicted
          completions along with the probabilities of alternative tokens at each
          position. Most developer should use our
          <a href="/docs/guides/text-generation/text-generation-models"
            >Chat Completions API</a
          >
          to leverage our best and newest models.
        </p>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div class="section endpoint">
      <div class="section-left">
        <div class="anchor-heading-root">
          <a
            class="anchor-heading-link"
            href="/docs/api-reference/completions/create"
          >
            <h2 class="anchor-heading" data-name="completions/create">
              Create completion
              <div color="orange" class="css-pms1cx">Legacy</div>
              <svg
                stroke="currentColor"
                fill="currentColor"
                stroke-width="0"
                viewBox="0 0 20 20"
                aria-hidden="true"
                class="anchor-heading-icon"
                height="15px"
                width="15px"
                xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
              >
                <path
                  fill-rule="evenodd"
                  d="M12.586 4.586a2 2 0 112.828 2.828l-3 3a2 2 0 01-2.828 0 1 1 0 00-1.414 1.414 4 4 0 005.656 0l3-3a4 4 0 00-5.656-5.656l-1.5 1.5a1 1 0 101.414 1.414l1.5-1.5zm-5 5a2 2 0 012.828 0 1 1 0 101.414-1.414 4 4 0 00-5.656 0l-3 3a4 4 0 105.656 5.656l1.5-1.5a1 1 0 10-1.414-1.414l-1.5 1.5a2 2 0 11-2.828-2.828l3-3z"
                  clip-rule="evenodd"
                ></path>
              </svg>
            </h2>
          </a>
        </div>
        <p>
          <span class="endpoint-text"
            ><span class="endpoint-method endpoint-method-post">post</span
            >&nbsp;<span class="endpoint-path"
              >https://api.openai.com/v1/completions</span
            ></span
          >
        </p>
        <div class="endpoint-summary">
          <p>Creates a completion for the provided prompt and parameters.</p>
        </div>
        <div class="param-section">
          <h3>Request body</h3>
          <div class="param-table" id="completions-create__table">
            <div class="param-row">
              <div class="param-row-header api-ref-anchor-link-hover">
                <a
                  href="#completions-create-model"
                  data-anchor="completions-create-model"
                  class="api-ref-anchor-link"
                  ><svg
                    xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
                    width="1em"
                    height="1em"
                    fill="currentColor"
                    viewBox="0 0 24 24"
                  >
                    <path
                      fill-rule="evenodd"
                      d="M18.293 5.707a4.657 4.657 0 0 0-6.586 0l-1 1a1 1 0 1 1-1.414-1.414l1-1a6.657 6.657 0 1 1 9.414 9.414l-1 1a1 1 0 0 1-1.414-1.414l1-1a4.657 4.657 0 0 0 0-6.586Zm-2.586 2.586a1 1 0 0 1 0 1.414l-6 6a1 1 0 0 1-1.414-1.414l6-6a1 1 0 0 1 1.414 0Zm-9 1a1 1 0 0 1 0 1.414l-1 1a4.657 4.657 0 0 0 6.586 6.586l1-1a1 1 0 0 1 1.414 1.414l-1 1a6.657 6.657 0 1 1-9.414-9.414l1-1a1 1 0 0 1 1.414 0Z"
                      clip-rule="evenodd"
                    ></path></svg
                ></a>
                <div class="param-name">model</div>
                <div class="param-type">string</div>
                <div class="param-reqd">Required</div>
              </div>
              <div class="param-desc">
                <div class="markdown-content">
                  <p>
                    ID of the model to use. You can use the
                    <a href="/docs/api-reference/models/list">List models</a>
                    API to see all of your available models, or see our
                    <a href="/docs/models/overview">Model overview</a> for
                    descriptions of them.
                  </p>
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>
            <div class="param-row">
              <div class="param-row-header api-ref-anchor-link-hover">
                <a
                  href="#completions-create-prompt"
                  data-anchor="completions-create-prompt"
                  class="api-ref-anchor-link"
                  ><svg
                    xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
                    width="1em"
                    height="1em"
                    fill="currentColor"
                    viewBox="0 0 24 24"
                  >
                    <path
                      fill-rule="evenodd"
                      d="M18.293 5.707a4.657 4.657 0 0 0-6.586 0l-1 1a1 1 0 1 1-1.414-1.414l1-1a6.657 6.657 0 1 1 9.414 9.414l-1 1a1 1 0 0 1-1.414-1.414l1-1a4.657 4.657 0 0 0 0-6.586Zm-2.586 2.586a1 1 0 0 1 0 1.414l-6 6a1 1 0 0 1-1.414-1.414l6-6a1 1 0 0 1 1.414 0Zm-9 1a1 1 0 0 1 0 1.414l-1 1a4.657 4.657 0 0 0 6.586 6.586l1-1a1 1 0 0 1 1.414 1.414l-1 1a6.657 6.657 0 1 1-9.414-9.414l1-1a1 1 0 0 1 1.414 0Z"
                      clip-rule="evenodd"
                    ></path></svg
                ></a>
                <div class="param-name">prompt</div>
                <div class="param-type">string or array</div>
                <div class="param-reqd">Required</div>
              </div>
              <div class="param-desc">
                <div class="markdown-content">
                  <p>
                    The prompt(s) to generate completions for, encoded as a
                    string, array of strings, array of tokens, or array of token
                    arrays.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                    Note that &lt;|endoftext|&gt; is the document separator that
                    the model sees during training, so if a prompt is not
                    specified the model will generate as if from the beginning
                    of a new document.
                  </p>
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>
            <div class="param-row">
              <div class="param-row-header api-ref-anchor-link-hover">
                <a
                  href="#completions-create-best_of"
                  data-anchor="completions-create-best_of"
                  class="api-ref-anchor-link"
                  ><svg
                    xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
                    width="1em"
                    height="1em"
                    fill="currentColor"
                    viewBox="0 0 24 24"
                  >
                    <path
                      fill-rule="evenodd"
                      d="M18.293 5.707a4.657 4.657 0 0 0-6.586 0l-1 1a1 1 0 1 1-1.414-1.414l1-1a6.657 6.657 0 1 1 9.414 9.414l-1 1a1 1 0 0 1-1.414-1.414l1-1a4.657 4.657 0 0 0 0-6.586Zm-2.586 2.586a1 1 0 0 1 0 1.414l-6 6a1 1 0 0 1-1.414-1.414l6-6a1 1 0 0 1 1.414 0Zm-9 1a1 1 0 0 1 0 1.414l-1 1a4.657 4.657 0 0 0 6.586 6.586l1-1a1 1 0 0 1 1.414 1.414l-1 1a6.657 6.657 0 1 1-9.414-9.414l1-1a1 1 0 0 1 1.414 0Z"
                      clip-rule="evenodd"
                    ></path></svg
                ></a>
                <div class="param-name">best_of</div>
                <div class="param-type">integer or null</div>
                <div class="param-optl">Optional</div>
                <div class="param-default">Defaults to 1</div>
              </div>
              <div class="param-desc">
                <div class="markdown-content">
                  <p>
                    Generates <code>best_of</code> completions server-side and
                    returns the "best" (the one with the highest log probability
                    per token). Results cannot be streamed.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                    When used with <code>n</code>, <code>best_of</code> controls
                    the number of candidate completions and
                    <code>n</code> specifies how many to return –
                    <code>best_of</code> must be greater than <code>n</code>.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                    <strong>Note:</strong> Because this parameter generates many
                    completions, it can quickly consume your token quota. Use
                    carefully and ensure that you have reasonable settings for
                    <code>max_tokens</code> and <code>stop</code>.
                  </p>
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>
            <div class="param-row">
              <div class="param-row-header api-ref-anchor-link-hover">
                <a
                  href="#completions-create-echo"
                  data-anchor="completions-create-echo"
                  class="api-ref-anchor-link"
                  ><svg
                    xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
                    width="1em"
                    height="1em"
                    fill="currentColor"
                    viewBox="0 0 24 24"
                  >
                    <path
                      fill-rule="evenodd"
                      d="M18.293 5.707a4.657 4.657 0 0 0-6.586 0l-1 1a1 1 0 1 1-1.414-1.414l1-1a6.657 6.657 0 1 1 9.414 9.414l-1 1a1 1 0 0 1-1.414-1.414l1-1a4.657 4.657 0 0 0 0-6.586Zm-2.586 2.586a1 1 0 0 1 0 1.414l-6 6a1 1 0 0 1-1.414-1.414l6-6a1 1 0 0 1 1.414 0Zm-9 1a1 1 0 0 1 0 1.414l-1 1a4.657 4.657 0 0 0 6.586 6.586l1-1a1 1 0 0 1 1.414 1.414l-1 1a6.657 6.657 0 1 1-9.414-9.414l1-1a1 1 0 0 1 1.414 0Z"
                      clip-rule="evenodd"
                    ></path></svg
                ></a>
                <div class="param-name">echo</div>
                <div class="param-type">boolean or null</div>
                <div class="param-optl">Optional</div>
                <div class="param-default">Defaults to false</div>
              </div>
              <div class="param-desc">
                <div class="markdown-content">
                  <p>Echo back the prompt in addition to the completion</p>
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>
            <div class="param-row">
              <div class="param-row-header api-ref-anchor-link-hover">
                <a
                  href="#completions-create-frequency_penalty"
                  data-anchor="completions-create-frequency_penalty"
                  class="api-ref-anchor-link"
                  ><svg
                    xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
                    width="1em"
                    height="1em"
                    fill="currentColor"
                    viewBox="0 0 24 24"
                  >
                    <path
                      fill-rule="evenodd"
                      d="M18.293 5.707a4.657 4.657 0 0 0-6.586 0l-1 1a1 1 0 1 1-1.414-1.414l1-1a6.657 6.657 0 1 1 9.414 9.414l-1 1a1 1 0 0 1-1.414-1.414l1-1a4.657 4.657 0 0 0 0-6.586Zm-2.586 2.586a1 1 0 0 1 0 1.414l-6 6a1 1 0 0 1-1.414-1.414l6-6a1 1 0 0 1 1.414 0Zm-9 1a1 1 0 0 1 0 1.414l-1 1a4.657 4.657 0 0 0 6.586 6.586l1-1a1 1 0 0 1 1.414 1.414l-1 1a6.657 6.657 0 1 1-9.414-9.414l1-1a1 1 0 0 1 1.414 0Z"
                      clip-rule="evenodd"
                    ></path></svg
                ></a>
                <div class="param-name">frequency_penalty</div>
                <div class="param-type">number or null</div>
                <div class="param-optl">Optional</div>
                <div class="param-default">Defaults to 0</div>
              </div>
              <div class="param-desc">
                <div class="markdown-content">
                  <p>
                    Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new
                    tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far,
                    decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line
                    verbatim.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                    <a href="/docs/guides/text-generation/parameter-details"
                      >See more information about frequency and presence
                      penalties.</a
                    >
                  </p>
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>
            <div class="param-row">
              <div class="param-row-header api-ref-anchor-link-hover">
                <a
                  href="#completions-create-logit_bias"
                  data-anchor="completions-create-logit_bias"
                  class="api-ref-anchor-link"
                  ><svg
                    xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
                    width="1em"
                    height="1em"
                    fill="currentColor"
                    viewBox="0 0 24 24"
                  >
                    <path
                      fill-rule="evenodd"
                      d="M18.293 5.707a4.657 4.657 0 0 0-6.586 0l-1 1a1 1 0 1 1-1.414-1.414l1-1a6.657 6.657 0 1 1 9.414 9.414l-1 1a1 1 0 0 1-1.414-1.414l1-1a4.657 4.657 0 0 0 0-6.586Zm-2.586 2.586a1 1 0 0 1 0 1.414l-6 6a1 1 0 0 1-1.414-1.414l6-6a1 1 0 0 1 1.414 0Zm-9 1a1 1 0 0 1 0 1.414l-1 1a4.657 4.657 0 0 0 6.586 6.586l1-1a1 1 0 0 1 1.414 1.414l-1 1a6.657 6.657 0 1 1-9.414-9.414l1-1a1 1 0 0 1 1.414 0Z"
                      clip-rule="evenodd"
                    ></path></svg
                ></a>
                <div class="param-name">logit_bias</div>
                <div class="param-type">map</div>
                <div class="param-optl">Optional</div>
                <div class="param-default">Defaults to null</div>
              </div>
              <div class="param-desc">
                <div class="markdown-content">
                  <p>
                    Modify the likelihood of specified tokens appearing in the
                    completion.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                    Accepts a JSON object that maps tokens (specified by their
                    token ID in the GPT tokenizer) to an associated bias value
                    from -100 to 100. You can use this
                    <a href="/tokenizer?view=bpe">tokenizer tool</a> to convert
                    text to token IDs. Mathematically, the bias is added to the
                    logits generated by the model prior to sampling. The exact
                    effect will vary per model, but values between -1 and 1
                    should decrease or increase likelihood of selection; values
                    like -100 or 100 should result in a ban or exclusive
                    selection of the relevant token.
